cc_text.paragraph: VAL has a few different methods for finding a location. You can find a location by using the Asset, Landgrid or Location search. As an example, we will focus on the steps to take to conduct a Landgrid search using the State/County/Township/Range parameters. When you have finished reading the text on this screen, click on the Play button to view a demonstration on how to conduct a Landgrid Search.
Begin your VAL search at the Search Toolbar.
Click the Search dropdown list. By default, the Asset search is active.
Select the Landgrid Search. The Landgrid Search popup box is displayed.
Click the small arrow to the right, in the State dropdown list. The State dropdown list expands.
Click the small arrow to the right, in the "County" dropdown list. The County dropdown list expands.
Select Roger Mills. ROGER MILLS is displayed.
Type a number in the Township (Twp) field.
Type a number in the Range (Rng) field.
Once the search criteria have been filled in click the Search button. The data grid will expand with the results. You can also hit the Enter key on your keyboard, instead of the Search button.
Click a record within the data grid. The map will zoom in to that record.
